docs.snippet: Boris Spassky, a former world Junior champion and one of the two Soviet players in the chess tournament at Mar del Plata in Argentina, defeated Bobby Fischer of Brooklyn, the United States champion, in the second round yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Boris Spassky, a former world Junior champion and one of the two Soviet players in the chess tournament at Mar del Plata in Argentina, defeated Bobby Fischer of Brooklyn, the United States champion, in the second round yesterday.

headline.main: SPASSKY DEFEATS FISCHER IN CHESS; Soviet Player Subdues U.S. Champion in 29 Moves, Tying Letelier for Lead

docs.snippet: Mikhail Botvinnik, the world chess champion, continuing the defense of his title against Mikhail Tal of Latvia, yesterday turned the tables on his chalenger, winning the eighth game of the twenty-four game series to reduce his rival's lead to 5 -- 3.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mikhail Botvinnik, the world chess champion, continuing the defense of his title against Mikhail Tal of Latvia, yesterday turned the tables on his chalenger, winning the eighth game of the twenty-four game series to reduce his rival's lead to 5 -- 3.

headline.main: BOTVINNIK BEATS TAL IN 41 MOVES; Champion Scores His First Victory to Cut Rival's Chess Lead to 5-3

docs.snippet: THOUGH the New York City Ballet does not stay away long between seasons at the City Center, it is always old-home-week when it returns. Last Tuesday, when it opened its spring series, after having closed its winter one only on Feb. 7, there was a...
docs.lead_paragraph: THOUGH the New York City Ballet does not stay away long between seasons at the City Center, it is always old-home-week when it returns. Last Tuesday, when it opened its spring series, after having closed its winter one only on Feb. 7, there was a warm and cozy family welcome for it, and the values of continuity and a permanent home were once again made more than clear.
docs.abstract: comment on reception for Amer ballet Theatre

headline.main: THE DANCE: CURTAIN UP; City Ballet Returns -- Juilliard Series

docs.snippet: THE first week-end of the New York City Ballet's spring season at the City Center brought back into the repertory several works that were novelties not so long ago.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE first week-end of the New York City Ballet's spring season at the City Center brought back into the repertory several works that were novelties not so long ago.

headline.main: Ballet: Onetime Novelties; ' Uruguay' by d'Amboise, 'Square Dance' and 'Colombia' Back at City Center

docs.snippet: Mikhail Botvinnik, the defending world chess champion, reduced the lead of Mikhail Tal of Lativa yesterday when he won the ninth game of the title series in Moscow, according to Soviet news sources. The game had been adjourned after fortyone moves on...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mikhail Botvinnik, the defending world chess champion, reduced the lead of Mikhail Tal of Lativa yesterday when he won the ninth game of the title series in Moscow, according to Soviet news sources. The game had been adjourned after fortyone moves on Saturday and Botvinnik won after fifty-eight moves.

headline.main: BOTVINNIK BEATS TAL IN 9TH GAME; Cuts Challenger's Lead to 5-4 in World Chess Play -- Spassky, Fischer Win

docs.snippet: Week Ended April 1, 1860 Firmness for the British pound sterling and a softer undertone for the Canadian dollar marked the foreign exchange trading for the past week. Business transacted was fairly heavy at times.
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended April 1, 1860 Firmness for the British pound sterling and a softer undertone for the Canadian dollar marked the foreign exchange trading for the past week. Business transacted was fairly heavy at times.

docs.snippet: Bobby Fischer, the three-time chess champion of the United States, yesterday retained second place in the international tournament at Mar del Plata, Argentina, with a brilliant effort in the sixth round against Alberto Foguelman of Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bobby Fischer, the three-time chess champion of the United States, yesterday retained second place in the international tournament at Mar del Plata, Argentina, with a brilliant effort in the sixth round against Alberto Foguelman of Argentina.

headline.main: FISCHER TRIUMPHS IN 72-MOVE GAME; Beats Foguelman to Retain Second Place in Argentine Chess -- Spassky Wins

docs.snippet: Brazil, one of the leading soccer nations of the world, has entered the new International Soccer League, which will bring professional big-league competition in this oldest of all football games to New York this year.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil, one of the leading soccer nations of the world, has entered the new International Soccer League, which will bring professional big-league competition in this oldest of all football games to New York this year.
